security_audit.summary: This is a pure narrative/story skill with no executable code. It contains only markdown documentation describing an interactive fiction chapter. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Players struggle to create satisfying endings for interactive stories. This skill provides a complete framework for crafting emotionally resonant finale chapters with meaningful choices and multiple endings.
actual_capabilities: Generates interactive fiction chapter scripts with branching narratives
Creates emotionally complex character decisions and dialogue
Provides multiple ending variations based on player choices
Includes detailed character psychology and emotional arcs
Offers branching conversation flows with player agency
limitations: Content is in Chinese language only
Requires adaptation for different story genres
No interactive execution - static documentation only

use_cases.title: Design branching story finales
use_cases.description: Use this framework to create emotionally satisfying endings for interactive fiction games with meaningful player choices.

use_cases.title: Craft space adventure conclusions
use_cases.description: Generate compelling finale chapters for space exploration narratives with complex character decisions.

use_cases.title: Build choice-based game endings
use_cases.description: Implement multi-ending systems where player decisions throughout the game affect the final outcome.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Chapter Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an interactive fiction chapter where a character must choose between two difficult options. Include dialogue, internal monologue, and at least 2 different endings.

prompt_templates.title: Emotional Decision Point
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a scene where the protagonist faces an emotional dilemma. Include their thought process, the stakes of each choice, and how it affects their relationships.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Ending Finale
prompt_templates.scenario: Write a story conclusion with branches
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a finale chapter with 3 distinct endings based on previous player choices. Include callbacks to earlier story moments and character growth.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Dialogue System
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complex dialogue tree where player responses significantly alter the story direction. Include emotional beats and character development moments.

output_examples.input: Create a finale where an astronaut must choose between returning to Earth or staying on an alien planet
output: Stage 1: Opportunity emerges - rescue signal detected or ship repair possible
Stage 2: Journey reflection - character reviews their growth and experiences
Stage 3: Choice analysis - weighing pros/cons of each option with emotional weight
Stage 4: Decision and consequences - 3+ distinct endings based on choice
Stage 5: Epilogue - closure for the character arc and player relationship

best_practices: Build emotional investment throughout the story before the finale choice
Ensure each ending feels earned based on player's previous decisions
Include callbacks to earlier story moments for narrative satisfaction
anti_patterns: Don't force a 'correct' ending - all choices should be valid
Avoid sudden character personality changes without justification
Don't dismiss the emotional weight of leaving relationships behind

faq.question: Is this skill only for space-themed stories?
faq.answer: The example is space-themed but the structure works for any genre. Adapt the setting and character details to fit your story.

faq.question: Can I create more than 3 endings?
faq.answer: Yes, the framework supports any number of endings. Add more branches in the decision stage and create unique epilogues for each.

faq.question: How do I handle player choices from previous chapters?
faq.answer: Reference key decisions in the reflection stage and let them influence which endings are available or how they're presented.

faq.question: Is the content language locked to Chinese?
faq.answer: The example uses Chinese/English mix for character voice, but you can write entirely in any language for your story.

faq.question: How long should a finale chapter be?
faq.answer: Aim for 40-60 minutes of reading time. This allows proper emotional buildup without overwhelming players.

faq.question: Can this work for non-interactive stories?
faq.answer: Yes, use the structure for any narrative finale. Simply remove the interactive choice elements and pick one ending.
